channel.title: Computer build
channel.description:
Well, I found this computer build on a website, found all the bits and was hoping someone could check it over for me.
MotherBoard: Gigabyte GA P35-DS3P http://scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=598575 £86.94 Inc VAT
CPU: Intel Core 2 Duo E6750 http://scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=632054 £116.31 Inc VAT
RAM: 2GB (2x1GB) Corsair TwinX XMS2, DDR2 http://www.scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=255300 £38.35 Inc VAT
Graphics: 512MB XFX 8800GT Alpha Dog, PCI-E (x16), 1800MHz GDDR3, GPU 625MHz, 2xDual Link DVI-I/S-Video, HDCP http://www.scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=712422 £187.86 Inc VAT
Soundcard: Creative X-Fi Extreme Audio Sound Card 24Bit 7.1Ch OEM http://www.scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=527290 £26.90 Inc VAT
HDD: 400 GB Samsung HD403LJ http://www.scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=691234 £54.27 Inc VAT
DVD: Samsung SH-S203N/RSMN 20xDVD±R http://www.scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=692680 £21.14 Inc VAT
Case: Antec 900 - Nine Hundred Ultimate Gamer Case with 200m Top Fan w/o PSU http://www.scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=501972 £67.79 Inc VAT
PSU: 460W Gigabyte PSU 24 PIN ACTIVE PFC LOW NOISE http://www.scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=691095 £25.84 Inc VAT
Total cost: £625.4 inc vat
Edit: Changed case.

item.title: Computer build
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Btw, are you breaking your computer building hymen here?

Yes.

RXVL:

Thats because he has a processor with a 1333 FSB Speed, which is bad, because it’s better to have a proc with a 800 FSB and DDR2-800 RAM because the speeds match up, beleive me. Thats why I said get the 6420, because it’s a proc with an 800 FSBS

[quote=“RXVL, post:13, topic:162568”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=221118.msg1917565#msg1917565 date=1197007674]
That’s true, you don’t want to throttle the RAM. Why not go the middle path and go 1066 for both?
[/quote]

That’s probably the best idea, other than the fact that 1333 and 1066 are relatively new and some glitches haven;t been ironed out yet.[/quote]

Would it be better to say, get a Intel Core 2 Quad-Core Q6600 G0 SLACR, 95W, S775, 2.40 GHz, 1066MHz FSB, 8MB Cache and something like this, 2GB (2x1GB) Corsair TwinX DDR2 XMS2 Dominator, PC2-8500 (1066), or would the quad be way to powerful, while everything else is working at it’s full capacity?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer build
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:12, topic:162568”][quote author=RXVL link=topic=221118.msg1917535#msg1917535 date=1197006544]
Thats because he has a processor with a 1333 FSB Speed, which is bad, because it’s better to have a proc with a 800 FSB and DDR2-800 RAM because the speeds match up, beleive me. Thats why I said get the 6420, because it’s a proc with an 800 FSBS, and you can get a mobo like this http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813121059 which is one of the best ones around.
[/quote]

That’s true, you don’t want to throttle the RAM. Why not go the middle path and go 1066 for both?[/quote]

That’s probably the best idea, other than the fact that 1333 and 1066 are relatively new and some glitches haven;t been ironed out yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer build
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

RXVL:

Thats because he has a processor with a 1333 FSB Speed, which is bad, because it’s better to have a proc with a 800 FSB and DDR2-800 RAM because the speeds match up, beleive me. Thats why I said get the 6420, because it’s a proc with an 800 FSBS, and you can get a mobo like this http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813121059 which is one of the best ones around.

That’s true, you don’t want to throttle the RAM. Why not go the middle path and go 1066 for both?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer build
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

RXVL:

Nice PSU, but I don’t have experience with Silverstone, I only use PCPower&Cooling PSUs so I can’t tell you. As for the mobo, look into this. http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813121314

Silverstone is great. Ridiculous efficiency, high quality, and quiet shit.

That Intel mobo looks like crap. Only 20 reviewers out of 50 gave it 5 stars. His mobo had 21 reviewers out of 30 give it 5 stars. Neither is SLI compatible. The Un-named, I suggest you get something SLI-compatible, so upgrading video cards would be cheaper. I don’t see why you have a vendetta against Gigabyte. You got unlucky a few times, but Gigabyte overall is a good brand.

If you would like something SLI, check out this (apparently on back-order) or this.

Here are the newegg links, in case I selected the wrong mobo’s for you.

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813130081
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813131153

Read full topic

item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Nice PSU, but I don’t have experience with Silverstone, I only use PCPower&Cooling PSUs so I can’t tell you. As for the mobo, look into this. http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813121314

EDIT: I forgot your a Ukfgt (just kidding :D). Tigerdirect has them too, http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/searchtools/item-Details.asp?EdpNo=3038920&sku=I69-2148

Read full topic

item.title: Computer build
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

That PSU looks solid. Go for it.

Btw, are you breaking your computer building hymen here?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer build
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

RXVL:

1) You need a different motherboard. I’ve had so many bad experiences with Gigabyte that it’s not even worth buying their mobos. Intel makes a smoking mobo that you know won’t have any problems.

Got any suggestions? Knowing me, I’ll buy a mobo that isn’t compatible with something.

RXVL:

2) I suggest downgrading your processor to the E6420. It’s cheaper than the one you specified and it’s more overclockable. I believe you can get about an 80% over clock on air cooling, and with the Antec 900 you should be able to go higher.

I don’t intend to over-clock, I might consider it since I’m not going to have the money until march, but I’d rather not.

EDIT: The E6420 is about $2 cheaper, I won’t bother.

RXVL:

3) This isn’t a problem, but a praise. The Antec 900 is IMO the best case ever. I have one myself and I fucking love it. I have 4 green 120mm LED fans, a liquid neon tube, 2 meteor lights, and 2 lazer lights. My system is also water cooled so i used the tray at the top to mount a reservoir because of the way it’s positioned.

Yeah, I was going to go with an Antec Solo, but I noticed the 900 has a big fan on the top, and I remember on my old desktop I needed to use a desk fan at times.

RXVL:

4) You need a better power supply, you’ll blow that one out in a heart beat because its a shitty brand. PC Power and Cooling (http://www.pcpower.com/home/) has kick ass power supplies, I have a Silencer 750 Quad, but you’ll probably only need the 610 (Because of all the fans + C2D Proc) but it would be more expandable if you got the 750.

What about this one? 750W SilverStone SST-ST75ZF Black SLi/Xfire Quiet Quad 12v Rail ATX12v 2.2 EPS12v 86% Eff’

xxlegitxx:

Lol, I spent more on a PSU on my $500 system. This Silverstone is highly recommended (I hope it’s the right one), with ~87% efficiency, and solid build. http://scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=355398

^ Look up. ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Computer build
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Lol, I spent more on a PSU on my $500 system. This Silverstone is highly recommended (I hope it’s the right one), with ~87% efficiency, and solid build. http://scan.co.uk/Products/ProductInfo.asp?WebProductID=355398

And I can’t believe they don’t have Patriot on that site. This is $37 USD with 4-4-4-12 timing. http://www.newegg.com/product/product.asp?item=N82E16820220144

Read full topic

item.title: Computer build
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Ok. You need some major changes.

  1. You need a different motherboard. I’ve had so many bad experiences with Gigabyte that it’s not even worth buying their mobos. Intel makes a smoking mobo that you know won’t have any problems.

  2. I suggest downgrading your processor to the E6420. It’s cheaper than the one you specified and it’s more overclockable. I believe you can get about an 80% over clock on air cooling, and with the Antec 900 you should be able to go higher.

  3. This isn’t a problem, but a praise. The Antec 900 is IMO the best case ever. I have one myself and I fucking love it. I have 4 green 120mm LED fans, a liquid neon tube, 2 meteor lights, and 2 lazer lights. My system is also water cooled so i used the tray at the top to mount a reservoir because of the way it’s positioned.

  4. You need a better power supply, you’ll blow that one out in a heart beat because its a shitty brand. PC Power and Cooling (http://www.pcpower.com/home/) has kick ass power supplies, I have a Silencer 750 Quad, but you’ll probably only need the 610 (Because of all the fans + C2D Proc) but it would be more expandable if you got the 750.

So theres my review of your system lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer build
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Only thing I’d change if it was my computers is I’d take a Seagate or Western Digital HDD other all others. I just find them really exceptionally reliable.
